parties.title: RelayCon: WWDC 2016
parties.details:
On June 13 at 6 PM we will be hosting an event at 111 Minna Street in San Francisco. Come grab a drink at the bar and hang out before a live panel starts covering that morning's news. Hosts from Connected will be joined by Serenity Caldwell and Jason Snell.
Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event?
Yes. The event will include an open bar, and as such, is ages 21 and up. You will be required to show an ID to enter.
Will I be able to touch Myke's beard?
No. Well, maybe. (Did we mention there's an open bar?)
What if I can't make it?
While that question makes us sad, we will be releasing the audio of the panel as that week's Connected episode. But you can't touch Myke's beard through your podcast player.

parties.title: WWDC Hike 2016
parties.details:
When
June 12th, 2016, the Sunday before WWDC. We'll leave at 2pm.

Where
We'll leave from Lands End. It's about a 20 minute drive from the Moscone. If you drive, you'll have to cab back to your car at the end since the route isn't a loop.

Hiking
It will take about 3-4 hours to hike 6.2 miles (10km). The terrain ranges from dirt trails, streets, and beaches. Comfortable walking shoes are recommended.

We'll see Lands End, Baker Beach, the Golden Gate Bridge, Crissy Field, and Fort Mason along the way. Click the pins on the map for details of each spot. We'll finish at In-N-Out in Fisherman's Wharf. Anyone that wants to stay and eat is welcome.

Don't feel like you have to do all of it. You're more than welcome to come, hike for a bit, and cab back to downtown when you're feeling done.

parties.title: WWDC Diversion
parties.details:
It wouldn't be WWDC without a little Diversion!
Come join your friends from Apteligent & Localytics for the 3rd annual WWDC Diversion Party at 620 Jones on Wednesday, June 15th.  
Mingle over some cocktails, reconnect with old colleagues, make new connections or just enjoy the ambiance. Whatever your reason, this is the place to be.
This can't-miss event has sold out in prior years, so don't be left in the dust. Get your ticket today!

* You must be 21 or older to attend.

parties.title: Party — AppStorey
parties.details: You know the computer. Tell your NeXTSTEP story to AppStorey at the AppStorey WWDC Party! This is your chance to learn about, or even contribute to the making of the AppStorey video documentary. We're going to set the record straight. Voice your unique point of view to the making of history's greatest copmuter, and help tell how this one copmuter made a collosal impact on today's mobile computing world. You were part of computer history. AppStorey T-shirts will be available to those who qualify for full or partial video interviews. Professional photographers, producers will be there to capture it all so dont miss out!

parties.title: WWDC Watching Party
parties.details:
Didn't get lucky enough to get a WWDC ticket this year? Don't worry, LinkedIn's got you covered - we're hosting a WWDC watching party from our SF office all day Monday - Thursday.
On Monday we’ll watch the keynote. After it ends, we'll serve lunch and give you the chance to mingle with other iOS devs in the community. After lunch, stick around to watch the Platforms State of the Union.
Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday, we’ll be watching the live sessions. Come and hang out with us and talk about what’s new this year (lunch not provided these days).

Registration
When registering for tickets, please RSVP only for dates you plan on attending. You'll need a separate ticket for each day.

Schedule
(subject to change since the WWDC schedule isn't out yet)

Monday
9am - 10am: Check in
10am - 12pm: Watch WWDC Keynote
12pm - 2:30pm: Lunch & Networking
2:30pm - 4:00pm: Watch Platforms State of The Union

Tuesday
9am - 5pm: Watching the live sessions.

Wednesday
9am - 5pm: Watching the live sessions.

Thursday
9am - 3pm: Watching the live sessions
3pm - ?: Happy hour at a near-by bar. No ticket required. (Not sponsored by LinkedIn)

FAQs
Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event?
No. All ages are welcome for the events at LinkedIn. For the Thursday happy hour, you are subject to the rules of the bar (which bar is TBD).

What are my transport/parking options getting to the event?
We highly recommend taking public transit, biking, or using a rideshare service as onsite parking is very limited.
Public transit: Muni bus 10 stops right in front of our building! We're also walking distance from the Montgomery BART/Muni rail station
Bikes: utilize the parking garage ramp down to the secured bike rooms (Please enter on Tehama Street). DO NOT bring bikes into the building lobby
Cars: Daily rate $25, Garage hours 7am-7pm

Where can I contact the organizer with any questions?
Email wwdc2016@linkedin.com

parties.title: Ballmer Peak-A-Thon
parties.details:
Originate are once again hosting the Ballmer Peak-A-Thon!
You will have 5 hours to find the elusive Ballmer Peak, and build the best worst business possible. We will provide a full bar, bartender, food and plenty of silly domain names to jump start the festivities.
How does it work? Simple:
Pick a domain name from our list.
Hack anything... as long as it fits your domain.
Show it off!
The Details:
Hardware - BYOL (Bring your own laptop), unless you want to code on a whiteboard or something.
Workflow - Five hours isn't a lot of time. Don't spend it tracking down SDK's or fighting with MongoDB - come prepared!
Ballmer PEAK, not Ballmer GUTTER - Our goal is to drink and code, not blackout and vom. Know your limits and everyone will have a good time. Ignore your limits and you may find more-than-embarrassing photos on reddit the next day.
Transportation - We'll have fun at the event, but be sober before you go anywhere. Even better… Uber.

parties.title: WWDC Livestreamed Swift Panel
parties.details:
NOTE:  The event is first-come, first-served.

We wish we had enough space for everyone, but we can only safely have so many people inside at once.

To make it fair for those who RSVP, we will be checking names at the door. Thanks! 





Welcome to Monday Night Live! Now 100% Swift!

(Or maybe 98%, there's so much to talk about & we shouldn't restrict ourselves.)

Featuring a panel discussion with: 

• Natasha Murashev, aka Natasha The Robot  

• Ayaka Nonaka, ‎iOS at Workflow  

• Ben Sandofsky, longtime software shipper 

• Jesse Squires, iOS at Instagram 

The panel will kick off with a retrospective into the last couple years of Swift, move to discussing this year’s developments across open source & WWDC, and end with your questions.



Livestreaming:

We will be live streaming the entire event! We hope that everyone, everywhere will be able to enjoy this panel.

Check back here on the day of the event to find the link.

In case you can't watch the live stream, don't worry! We're also recording the event, and we'll be posting the video shortly after the event. Sign up here to be emailed when the video goes up.



Panelist Bios: 

Natasha Murashev 

Natasha is an iOS developer by day and a robot by night. She blogs about Swift, watchOS, and iOS development on her blog, natashatherobot.com, curates a fast-growing weekly Swift newsletter, This Week in Swift, and organizes the try! Swift Conference around the world (the next one is in NYC!). She's currently living the digital nomad life as her alter identity: @NatashaTheNomad. 

Ayaka Nonaka 

Ayaka is an iOS engineer at Workflow, and was previously at Venmo on their iOS team. She’s a huge fan of Swift and has given talks on natural language processing in Swift, scripting in Swift, and a few other things. Recently she’s been writing at Learn Swift ↯ to show how powerful the language can be. 

Ben Sandofsy

Ben has shipped software for over a decade, from tiny startups to giant enterprise companies.  He's worked on Periscope, Twitter for iPhone, and Twitter for Mac. He's a CodePath instructor, an advisor to Shyp, and was a technical consultant for HBO's Silicon Valley. On Wednesday, catch his AltConf talk, “Building Periscope Sketches.” 

Jesse Squires

Jesse is a software developer who works on iOS at Instagram. He writes about Swift and Objective‑C on his blog at jessesquires.com, and contributes to many open source projects on GitHub. He loves running and learning new things, and is fueled primarily by black coffee and black metal.

About your Moderator: JP Simard  

JP is an Objective-C and Swift engineer at Realm, a fast mobile database. He’s also the creator of jazzy (the Swift and Objective-C documentation tool Apple forgot to release) and a co-organizer of the SLUG (i.e., this meetup), which is the largest Swift user group in the world.



Schedule:   

6:00pm: Doors open for people with confirmed RSVPs.  

6:30 - 7:00pm: Refreshments and food. Food will include options for omnivores, vegans, and gluten-free folks. We will not be serving alcohol at this meetup, but we'll have plenty of soda options.

6:45pm: Doors open to waitlisted people!

7:00pm:  Panel + Q&A

Afterward, you're welcome to stay and chat. 



Location:

It's just a 15-minute walk from Moscone, down toward AT&T Park.

The Realm office is on Townsend St. between 2nd and 3rd. 

Look for the door-person standing outside the building. He or she will guide you up. 

Getting there:  

•  5-minute walk to the King St. Caltrain station. 20-minute walk from the Powell St. BART Station.

•  The building entrance is next to the parking garage. 

•  Bike Parking: You're welcome to bring your bike inside, but you'll need to carry it to the 2nd floor.

• Please note that the building doesn't have an elevator so the venue isn't handicap-accessible unfortunately. 



Thanks to: 

Realm for hosting and providing food + drinks.

Questions? 

Email Chris at ck@realm.io.

parties.title: NSHipster Pub Quiz!
parties.details:
PLEASE NOTE:  The event is first-come, first-served – only the first 200 will be admitted. RSVPing is required but does not guarantee entry. 

We wish we had enough space for everyone, but we can only safely have so many people inside at once.

To make it fair for those who RSVP, we will be checking names at the door. Thanks! 



Join NSHipster at Realm HQ for the eighth annual edition of the NSHipster Pub Quiz! 



What?

Join us for the eighth edition of the NSHipster Pub Quiz! You'll answer four rounds of ten questions each, challenging your knowledge of Objective-C, Swift, and Cocoa, along with all things Apple, from the prosaic to the arcane. Come with a team or figure it out when you get there – in either case, space is limited, so RSVP now!

Come by Realm HQ for delicious food and drinks starting at 6:30. The quiz starts once everyone has teamed up and settled in, around 7:30. Stick around afterwards to gloat or commiserate, or just to catch up with your fellow NSHipsters.

All ages are welcome! We will have plenty of non-alcoholic drinks in addition to beer. You must be 21 or older to drink alcohol.



Where?

• Realm is located at 148 Townsend between 2nd and 3rd.

• An easy 15 minute walk from Moscone down 3rd St. (Map from Moscone)

• A 5 minute walk from the King Street Caltrain station.  



When?

6:30pm: Doors, food, beer + range of non-alcoholic drinks 

7:30pm: Brain-wrenching quiz 



Who:

Your host Nate Cook, a couple hundred (!!!) fiendish competitors, and the gracious folks at Realm.

parties.title: Beard Bash 2016
parties.details:
Join Jim Dalrymple and iMore for an incredible night of music from The Department of Rock and headliners, Airplane Mode.

You must bring your RSVP to the venue in order to get entry into the party. You must be 21 because we will be serving free beer and wine throughout the night.

Please arrive early. Having an RSVP does not guarantee entry into the event.

Many thanks to our sponsors, Pixelmator, MacPaw, Hover, and Microsoft, for making this party a reality!

parties.title: James Dempsey and the Breakpoints LIVE
parties.details:
Join the WWDCGirls and James Dempsey and the Breakpoints for an evening of mingling and music to benefit App Camp For Girls!

Doors open at 7:00 for the WWDCGirls cocktail hour with plenty of time to meet and mingle.
The music starts at 8:30 when James Dempsey and the Breakpoints take the stage to perform a full concert of humorous nerdy songs including favorites from their #5 Billboard-charting comedy album, Backtrace.
There will be an open bar all evening, with top-shelf liquors, beer and wine flowing from 7:00 - 11:00 pm.
It's our goal to raise $20,000 to support App Camp For Girls at this event. Your generous donation will go directly toward funding this year's programming and future growth.
This event is open to everyone 21 years of age and older.

parties.title: Yelp WWDC 2016 After Party
parties.details:
Join us for our 4th annual WWDC after party! We'll being enjoying drinks and appetizers throughout the night. 
Agenda: 
6:30 PM - Doors Open 
8:00 PM - Doors Close
9:30 PM - Event Ends

parties.title: Official WWDC iParty
parties.details:
Can we buy you a drink?
Mark your calendars - It's going down! Flurry & Testlio's Official WWDC iParty kicks off on Wednesday, June 15th at 10:30 PM, and we want you to be there. Infusion Lounge (124 Ellis Street) is hosting the heavy hitters in mobile at this exclusive event. Space is extremely limited so please RSVP to be added to the waitlist and we’ll reach out with confirmation.

parties.title: Women at WWDC Lunch
parties.details:
Join us for our annual lunch! Get together, meet fellow Women at WWDC, and enjoy some good food.
This year we are working together with Sound Off to raise money for grants to fellow women speakers at Cocoa conferences. 100% of your optional contributions will go towards this cause!
Food and drink are fully paid for by our sponsors; come hungry and ready to network! We're serving a light lunch including vegetarian and other options.
Don't have a WWDC badge? No problem! We want you to come anyway! Know of anyone who would enjoy this? Please pass it along!
This event is only open to individuals who identify as women in a way that is significant to them.
Join us on Wednesday June 15th for James Dempsey and the Breakpoints LIVE - benefitting App Camp For Girls, which is open to everyone age 21 and over. Follow @wwdcgirls on Twitter for other event announcements.
This event is covered by our Code of Conduct: http://www.wwdcgirls.com/code-of-conduct/

parties.title: 2016 Reveal WWDC Meetup
parties.details:
We're kicking off WWDC with a Reveal meetup! Chat with the developers of Reveal and get a glimpse of what we have in store for the next major release.
Join us at the S&R Lounge in Hotel Zetta, just a short walk from Moscone. Get there early for the first round of drinks on us.

parties.title: WWDC Lyft Happy Hour
parties.details: Come join us at Lyft's new HQ for a WWDC Happy Hour! We'll have food/drinks to enjoy and lots of time to mingle, make new friends, and hear a little bit more about iOS at Lyft.

parties.title: Realm 1.0 Launch Party!
parties.details:
PLEASE NOTE:  The event is first-come, first-served – only the first 200 will be admitted. RSVPing is required but does not guarantee entry. 

We wish we had enough space for everyone, but we can only safely have so many people inside at once.

To make it fair for those who RSVP, we will be checking names at the door. Thanks! 

Some friends are in town, we're launching 1.0... sound like a party!! 🎉💯🎂

Do you love Realm? Do you want to be loved by Realm in return?

Then this will be the party for you. With Realm developers from all over the world in town for WWDC and Realm 1.0 landing, we couldn't think of a better time to celebrate. We never could have gotten here without a whole lot of participation and support from you. Join us in celebrating Realm 1.0 & the community who helped make it happen! YEAH! 



Let there be CAKE (also other foods)! 🍗🍠🎂

Come join us for a night of mingling, food, announcements, and of course...cake! We'll have updates about where Realm is headed post-1.0, and what's up today and in the future! 🤖

Realm would not be where it is today without all of the loyal developers, so let us show you our appreciation!  Check out some more information about 1.0 here: https://realm.io/news/realm-1.0/



All of our events are subject to our Code of Conduct.  

Food options will accommodate omnivores, vegans, and gluten-free folks. The only alcohol we will be serving at this meetup will be the champagne toast. 🍾 



SCHEDULE: 📅🕕🍰

6:00pm: Doors open. Refreshments and food.

Also 6:00pm: Let the games begin! True to regular Realm Meetup fashion, we will have Mario Kart! Bring your A-game!

7:00pm: A short talk about what's next on the Realm roadmap!

Afterwards: 🍰, 🍾, stay and chat with our iOS team and fellow Realm users! 😄



GETTING HERE: 🗺 🔜 🏢

• The Realm office is on Townsend St. between 2nd and 3rd. 

• The building entrance is next to the parking garage. Someone will be outside to let you in starting at 6pm.

• It's just a 5-minute walk to the King St. Caltrain station, or a 20-minute walk from the Powell Street BART Station.

• Bike Parking: You can bring your bike inside, but you'll need to carry it to the 2nd floor. Unfortunately, the building doesn't have an elevator. 

Questions? Email Shadi at sn@realm.io.

parties.title: Twitter WWDC Viewing Party
parties.details: We are showcasing our commitment to supporting the mobile developer community by continuing our tradition of hosting a WWDC viewing party. We look forward to watching with you.

parties.title: The Photo App Developer Mind-Meld Social
parties.details:
Meet your photo app peers at our After Hours WWDC event
The Photo App Developer Mind-Meld Social 

The What:
Food, beer, discussions and networking with your peers!
An interactive panel discussion and dialogue with top industry app developers and thought-leaders about WWDC and what any announcements might mean for photo developers, led by Hans Hartman, Chair of Mobile Photo Connect.
Meet your colleague photo app developers from all over the world (those attending WWDC + Bay Area-based photo app developers)

The Who:
Ching-Mei Chen, Co-founder of PicCollage
Michael Vitrano, iOS engineer at Adobe
Yaron Inger, co-founder and CTO of Lightricks (makers of Facetune and Enlight)
Moderator: Hans Hartman, Suite 48 Analytics

parties.title: WWDC Happy Hour
parties.details:
Apple's Worldwide Developer's conference is coming up next month and most of the event is taking place at the Moscone center just across the street from our San Francisco office.
As a way of showing our appreciation of the iOS developer community, Climate is hosting a happy hour on Tuesday of the conference (June 14th).
Details about the event are below — please mark your calendars and if you know of others who are attending the conference (or who are following along via the live stream), please invite them to join us.
In addition to drinks and food, there will also be a Women's Networking Breakout led by Preeti Kaur.
Happy Hour Details:
When: Tuesday, June 14th from 4-6:30 PM; details:
Doors open: 4 pm
Quick intro to Climate: 5 pm
Women’s networking hour: 5:15-6:15 PM
Start wrapping up: 6:30 PM
Where: Climate SF office: 201 3rd St, 11th Floor, San Francisco
External guests should claim a free ticket on EventBrite (link here) so we can make sure we don't exceed our capacity

parties.title: Designer Meetup
parties.details:
AN EVENT HOSTED BY NYLAS, SKETCH & DESIGN DETAILS

Join us for a night hosted by Nylas with the fine folks from Sketch and Design Details at the gorgeous Nylas San Francisco office during WWDC week! 

Socialize with some great folks, skilled designers and enjoy fantastic goodies, drinks and snacks. We'll have a limited stock of some design swag!

parties.title: Microsoft & Xamarin WWDC Party
parties.details: Come join Microsoft and Xamarin after the WWDC 2016 State of the Union. We're located just around the corner from the Bill Graham Civic Auditorium in the Twitter building. We'll have plenty of food and drinks and you'll be entered to win one of three prizes valued at over $300 each (Apple Watch or Xbox One). Come discuss iOS with the developers of Outlook, Office, HockeyApp, SwiftKey, MileIQ, and many, many more.

parties.title: Nest WWDC Mixer
parties.details:
Nest, the leading connected home brand, is hosting a mixer on Tuesday, June 14th at Thirsty Bear Brewing Co.- just a short walk from the Moscone Center. Whether you are local or visiting for WWDC, we invite you to stop by and meet our team, including Nest VP of Apps and Services, Nik Sathe.
Doors will open at 5:00pm. Appetizers and drinks will be served. 
Only one ticket per person, thank you!

parties.title: Kick Off WWDC with Mapbox
parties.details: We're kicking off WWDC on June 14th, and you're invited to take part in the festivities! Hear about the latest mobile developments from the Mapbox team over food and drinks!

parties.title: WWDC 2016 Breakfast
parties.details:
What's in it for me?
Come have a hearty pre-WWDC breakfast courtesy of thoughtbot before heading down to Moscone! Say hello to other early rising developers & designers while sipping on mimosas.

parties.title: State of the Union 2016
parties.details: 2016 has been a big year for CocoaPods, come join us at our State of the Union.

parties.title: sfMacIndie 10th Anniversary!
parties.details: The premier networking event that kicks off WWDC.

parties.title: watchOS 3 Features Day
parties.details:
We had fun last year at the Apple Watch Hackathon. This year during WWDC, we're going to have another event. It will be slightly different. 



Open source coding day.  

Everyone will work in teams to build a single feature showcase of watchOS 3. These will all be combined into an app where you can select each teams’ work from a list. This is ambitious. It'll be like the WatchKit catalog except whole features, not mere interface elements. The combined app will be released as open source so that the wider world can learn how to do all the cool new things in watchOS. We'll all work from the watchOS 3 Features project on GitHub.

Designers welcome.

This is the fun part. The interface should look rad. We'll need screen mockups, icons, cartoon characters -- the works. If you're a designer, show off your work on this cutting edge platform.

What to expect.

This is the awesome video capturing last year’s event:



Learn.

Excited about this event? Get your head in the game by reading watchOS 2 by Tutorials. The book is packed with everything you need to know to be an expert. Study that to learn all the ins and outs of watchOS.

Food.

Currently I have no sponsors for this event so we'll have to bring our own food and eat out. There are several restaurants in the area.

Sponsors.

Speaking of which, get your company's name in front of designers and developers.

Venue.

Sandbox Suites South Park has graciously donated their space to us. It has presentation area, work area, and meeting rooms. That's a great setup for this type of event. That said, there is limited space at our venue. I'm going to put the RSVP limit at 100. If you're not going to actively participate, please sit this one out so that we have enough room for the participants.

Volunteer.

This will be a productive day. If you want to be a part of the action, but haven't been practicing code and design, come volunteer.

parties.title: buddybuild WWDC Happy Hour
parties.details:
Join the buddybuild team and check out the SlackHQ office for a WWDC happy hour!
We'll have free food / drinks, t-shirts and other goodies to give away, and will help you setup your first mobile CI build!
Mix, mingle, discuss the latest Apple news, and leave with your app up and running on buddybuild!

Buddybuild is the continuous integration, delivery, user feedback and crash reporting platform that's designed and built specifically for mobile app developers.
Slack is a messaging app for teams. It brings all your team's communication and files in one place, where they're instantly searchable and available wherever you go.

parties.title: iOS Engineering at Square
parties.details:
Square’s iOS engineering team invites you to join us for an evening of lightning talks, plus food and drinks with your fellow iOS engineers during WWDC.

Join us at The Box SF, an 8 minute walk from Moscone West.
 
 Doors open at 5:30pm, talks start at 6:00pm.
Check-in will close during talks and re-open from 7:00 - 8:00pm
Drinks & bites from 7:00pm to 9:00pm.
 
Note – All attendees must be respectful and adhere to the JSConf Code of Conduct. Thanks!

parties.title: The Talk Show Live From WWDC 2016
parties.details: The annual live audience episode of America’s favorite three-star podcast, at the end of the second day of WWDC. John Gruber will be joined by a cavalcade of special guest stars, or perhaps just one special guest star, or maybe it’ll just be an hour-long monologue.

parties.title: Button WWDC Selfie Soirée
parties.details:
Join Button on Wednesday evening for our 2nd annual selfie soirée of extensive proportions. 
 
We'll be at nearby 111 Minna Gallery, with an open bar, Del Popolo pizza, great music, and - most importantly - selfie backdrops to rival the likes of Apple's desktop backgrounds.
 
Left your selfie stick at home? Don't worry, we'll have plenty on hand. 
 
#ButtonSelfieSoiree

Featuring DJ Kelly
SF's own, spinning all night

parties.title: WWDC iOS Panel ft. Zendesk, Trello, Slack, & Branch
parties.details:
Attending WWDC? Not attending but closely watching? Either way, join us at Zendesk HQ on Monday June 13th as we bring together an awesome panel to discuss how Zendesk, Slack, Trello, & Branch view 'Being a Good iOS Citizen'. The discussion will cover topics around how these engineers see developing for a mobile ecosystem where integration with hardware (Watch), AI (Siri SDK?), and other native and mobile apps matters. 
Note: Space is limited and registered attendees will be admitted on a first come, first serve basis. Must be 21+ years old to attend.
Schedule:
6:30-7:00 - Networking, Drinks, & Food
7:00-7:45 - Panel featuring Zendesk, Slack, Trello and Branch 
7:45-8:00 - Q&A
8:00-8:30 - More Networking, Drinks & Food
Panelists:
- Pierre-Alain Bouchard, Mobile Development Manager @ Zendesk
- Don Frehulfer, Sr. iOS engineer @ Trello
- Stas Zhukovskiy, Evangelist @ Branch
- TBA @ Slack
& Moderated by Hamid Palo, Director of Product Partnerships @ Trello

parties.title: WWDC Watch Party
parties.details:
Come join the Medium iOS team watch the WWDC Keynote! 

We will be watching the live stream from 10am-noon in the Medium office, and will provide coffee and breakfast starting at 9:30am. Afterwards, we will provide lunch so we can discuss all of the announcements. 

9:30-10: Coffee / Snacks / Mingle

10-12pm Watch Keynote

12-1pm: Lunch / etc

you’ll be watching the live stream anyways, so come watch with us ;)

parties.title: WWDC Uber Happy Hour
parties.details:
Please drop by for a casual Uber hosted happy hour between 6:30p and 9p on 6/15 to meet and mingle with fellow WWDC attendees along with iOS engineers from Uber.  
We will have a special fireside chat with Jeff Holden, Uber's Chief Product Officer and the creator of Amazon Prime.  
Food and drinks will be provided.
Hope to see you there!

parties.title: eero WWDC/AltConf Party
parties.details:
Come eat, drink, and be merry with the eero engineering team! We'll be celebrating across the way from WWDC & AltConf and would love to meet you!

We'll have free food, drinks, and a chance to win an eero 3-pack! We'll also have a photobooth, charging station, eero swag, and the eero team to answer any of your questions!

Make sure to bring your WWDC or AltConf badge for entry and we'll see you soon!
